summary: This is a comprehensive background check report on Richard Kahn, generated on July 9, 2019. It details his personal information, addresses, work affiliations, business connections, and associates. The report shows his role as Vice-Chairman of the Foundation for Child Development and lists his connections to various businesses and foundations, including The C.O.U.Q. Foundation, Inc., where Jeffrey Epstein and Darren Indyke are also listed as officers. This document appears to be a financial background report or due diligence report on Richard Kahn, generated on or around July 9, 2019. It compiles business filings, corporate records, liens, judgments, and lawsuit information associated with Richard Kahn and various entities, including a notable connection to The C.O.U.Q. Foundation, Inc., which lists Jeffrey E. Epstein and Darren K. Indyke as officers. This document is an individual financial report on Richard Kahn, detailing his real estate transactions, relatives, associates, and vehicle registration. It appears to be a background or due diligence report, likely compiled by law enforcement or a financial investigator, listing property transfers, family connections, and checking for criminal or sanctions records.

events.description: A civil new filing (unlawful detainer) is made against Richard Kahn in the Civil Court of the City of New York for $1,783.

keyFacts: Richard Kahn is closely associated with Jeffrey Epstein through their shared roles as officers in The C.O.U.Q. Foundation, Inc.
Kahn held a significant leadership role as Vice-Chairman of the Foundation for Child Development, a nonprofit with substantial assets.
The background report was generated on July 9, 2019, shortly after Epstein's arrest, suggesting investigative interest in his associates.
Kahn's professional profile includes being a Certified Public Accountant and an insurance agent, with numerous business affiliations.
The report flags that a residential address associated with Kahn is also used as a business address, and that a P.O. Box is listed.
Richard Kahn is directly linked to Jeffrey E. Epstein and Darren K. Indyke through their shared roles as officers of The C.O.U.Q. Foundation, Inc., a Delaware non-profit incorporated in 2008.

The report details numerous business entities registered at high-end New York City apartment addresses (all with 'Apt 7C' and zip code 10021), suggesting a pattern of business registrations at residential locations.
Richard Kahn has a history of financial liens, including a federal tax lien from 1992 for $23,945 and a civil court filing from 2000.
A 2016 UCC-1 filing shows Richard Kahn and Lisa Kahn as co-debtors on a property at 130 East 75th Street, with First Republic Bank as the secured party.
The document is a compiled financial background report, likely generated for due diligence or investigative purposes, dated July 9, 2019.
Richard Kahn is the subject of a detailed financial and background report dated July 9, 2019, listing real estate holdings, relatives, and associates.
Kahn co-owns a Manhattan cooperative with Lynne Kahn (purchased 2015) and a Manhattan condominium with Lisa Kahn (purchased 2008).
The report lists numerous relatives of Richard Kahn, including several deceased individuals (Francine, Irwin, Carol R, Gary) and associates like John T. Moore and Karyn L. Moore.
An associate analytics chart checks multiple individuals (relatives and associates) for records like global arrests, OFAC sanctions, and bankruptcy, with all returning negative results.
Richard Kahn is registered as the owner of a 2011 Chevrolet Suburban, with a residence listed in New York County (ZIP 10021).
